DelegatedWallet

balanceOf

devdoc.author: Joseph Reed
devdoc.details: This contract's goal is to make it easy for anyone to add utility to their cryptocurrency wallet through      the use of delegates. In general, Delegates will be smart contracts that can transfer funds out of the      wallet in predefined ways. Only the owner can add or remove delegates.

params.delegate: The address of the new delegate

addDelegate(address).return: True if the delegate was successfully added

params.delegateList: The list of addresses to set as delegates

params.token: The token to fetch the balance of

balanceOf(address).return: The balance of the specified token

params.callAddress: The address of the contract to call
params.callData: The data to send to the call address
params.callValue: The amount of ether to attach with the call

call(address,uint256,bytes).return: success returns true if the call throws no errors.returnData contains the returned result of the call

params.i: The index from which to fetch the delegate address

getDelegateList().return: An address array of all current delegates

params.delegate: The delegate address from which to grab the index

params._owner: The address that owns the wallet

params.delegate: The address of an existing delegate

removeDelegate(address).return: True if the delegate was successfully removed

params.delegateList: The list of addresses to set as delegates

params.amount: The amount of tokens to be transferred
params.token: The address of the token to transfer

transfer(address,address,uint256).return: True if the transfer was successful

devdoc.title: Delegated Wallet

addDelegate(address).notice: //////////////////////// Owner Functions ////////////////////////Add a new delegate to the list of delegates

addDelegates(address[]).notice: Add a new delegate to the list of delegates

balanceOf(address).notice: Convenience function to fetch the token balance of the provided token

getDelegateAt(uint256).notice: Fetch a delegate address at a particular index

getDelegateList().notice: This function is for easily fetching the current list of delegates

getIndexOf(address).notice: Fetch the index of a particular delegate address. Note: if the index returns '0',         it must be called in conjuction with isDelegate() due to '0' being a default return value

initialize(address).notice: Initializes the wallet. Uses 'initialize()' instead of a constructor to make use of the clone         factory at https://github.com/optionality/clone-factory. In general, 'initialize()' should be         called directly following it's deployment through the use of a factory.

isDelegate(address).notice: //////////////////////// Getter Functions ////////////////////////Determine if a given address is a delegate of this wallet

removeDelegate(address).notice: Remove an existing delegate from the list of delegates

removeDelegates(address[]).notice: Remove an existing delegate from the list of delegates

totalDelegates().notice: Get the current total number of delegates
